snippet: Lester Brown, who has long been tracking how much grain the world grows, figures the global cupboard has a 77-day supply, only half the amount of a good year. Food supply, as he has warned, also serves as a kind of barometer for social unrest.
abstract: Lester Brown, who has long been tracking how much grain the world grows, figures the global cupboard has a 77-day supply, only half the amount of a good year. Food supply, as he has warned, also serves as a kind of barometer for social unrest.

headline.main: Going Against the Grain of Complacency
